Class LightLocalizer

java.lang.Object
  LightLocalizer

public class LightLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object

Class that performs light correction using two light sensors

Version:
3.0 November 28 2013
Author:
Vanessa Jones, Christopher Petryna, Simon Lei, Taylor Dotsikas, Muhammad Hannan and Caroline Wu

Class constructor

Parameters:
cs1 - import ColorSensor from Port.1
cs2 - import ColorSensor from Port.2
odo - import odometer to correct
leftMotor - import left motor to move the left wheel
righMotor - import right motor to move the right wheel
Method Detail

doLocalization

public void doLocalization()
Performs light localization as the robot travels over a gridline and corrects odometer

isLine

public boolean isLine(double light,
                      int line)
Determines if the robot is detecting a grid line

Parameters:
light - normalized light value returned by the light sensor
line - determines which sensor read the values (for calibration purposes)

setLocalizing

public void setLocalizing(boolean isLocalizing)
Sets the robot to localizing/not localizing

Parameters:
isLocalizing - sets the robot's status.

updateOdo

public void updateOdo()
Updates the odometer, after going over a line

isLocalizing

public boolean isLocalizing()
Determines if the robot is perfoming light localization

Returns:
the status of the robot's light localization. Returns true if the robot is localizing and false othewise.
